title: I can't believe laser turrets reducing true damage is intended
body:
I just went in a game with a friend, custom to test this out, we both took smite.

At level 1 smite does 390 damage.

Was under the laser turret taking aggro and dealt 331 damage to the minion with smite.

Riot please fix this bug, it can cost champs like Darius, Cho'Gath, Olaf, and many more a TON of games.


Edit: Just tested with Olaf and Irelia, Olaf did 101 before laser agro, did 86 true damage with agro.

Irelia did 15 true damage with her W before agro, 12 with agro.

Actually, it doesn't work through invulnerable shields.. but in this case it's because the damage is not being reduced, the champion is debuffed.  Seperate thing.

The turrets debuff your champion to do x % less total damage the longer it stays on them, no matter what kind of damage.  This is intended.

Now I suppose it could be argued it hurts true damage champions too much, but I'm not sure how they would adjust it to make an exception for only that one type of damage.

It's against the very concept and theme of true damage and it's inconsistent with Riot's past stance on the the mechanic's interaction. True damage, unless totally mitigated or avoided through the use of a spell shield, or a state of invulnerability (such as Trynd, Poppy, and Kayle ults) should always deal the exact amount of damage listed by the ability. True damage abilities have been balanced around this factor for years, and I see no reason to change it now.

Wrong.  Riot a while back made a statement that True damage will always, without fail, do the damage listed on the tooltip assuming the target is able to take damage from that source.  No more, no less.  This was a statement they made when they fixed many champs amping or reducing true damage (Usually their ignites being what was amped) with broad %damage modifiers (Like swain's E, or Poppy's ult's damage amp, or other champs with damage redux effects).  This statement was applied to things like Darius's ult being reduced by Exhaust back when it reduced damage by 70%, vs it's current 35% damage redux + 35% AS slow, which is the closest comparison case to this.

Why is this guy being downvoted? Sona's Diminuendo did reduce true damage at one point, and Riot fixed that calling it a bug.
True Damage should not be reduced by anything.

True damage can be reduced by a few effects, just as some can be gained by a few effects (Ahri AP, Olaf AD, Cho AP). The real difference is that no matter how much armor or magic resist is accumulated, those won't reduce the damage... and yet many other defensive effects claim True Damage as an exception. True Damage hardly needs this buff. It should be reducible by debuffing the enemy champion, as often they have the option of buffing it.

In other words:

Armor / MR is countered by Armor Pen / Magic Pen
Physical / Magical damage is countered by Armor / MR
True Damage buffing (Ahri/Olaf/Cho scaling) is countered by debuffing damage

It hardly needs spelled out, as the gimmick should never have been introduced in the first place, but True Damage needs no such buff, especially in a game where HP is getting harder and harder to come by.

Scaling =/= increasing damage.

Scaling = FUCKING SCALING.

Increasing or decreasing damage, by this definition, is anything that alters the printed damage of the ability. If the printed damage of an ability is 100 (+10% AP), and a champion's AP is 200, then the damage isn't "increased" to 120, *that's just the printed damage of the ability.*

... What? It scales, and the damage increases. 100 damage becomes 120. Tell Irelia about how scaling makes no difference. She couldn't if she tried. And, this is much more than you can say for armor/MR on the other side. Printed damage is still damage, and more damage than without the scaling. Damage with absolutely no method of mitigation, other than of course very few damage decreasing abilities. Few champs get True Damage, and few champs get to decrease it. And towers.

With HP being hard to stack much in the game anymore, it's even more abusive. Whether or not True Damage is consistent, it does not need such a buff anyway. Champs like Vayne would have basically no threat from lategame destruction, and Cho can combo chomp anything with ease, which wouldn't be hard to survive on Cho, anyways, as his ultimate is one of the few remaining HP bastions. Even Olaf can wear down an enemy while taking damage, and sneak in a quick execution strike with full power, unlike the rest of his kit, or anyone's kit that doesn't contain true damage. Towers are meant to be a pain to everyone equally, and leaving True Damage out of it would only reinforce the joke that tower defense is.

No: Nobody gets to decrease it. Name one champion that decreases true damage. Oh wait, you can't, because that champion doesn't exist. Sona did once: It was a bug. It was fixed in a bugfix. It was not a balance change.

And again, Increasing/Decreasing damage is unrelated to scaling. For example, lets say we've got an ability that says "You deal 20% bonus damage to the target." Your physical damage would be increased by 20%. Your magic damage would be increased by 20%. Your true damage WOULD NOT be increased by 20%. Because True damage always deals the printed damage. If you have an ability that deals 10 true damage, it deals 10 true damage. If you have an ability that deals true damage based on 10% of your AP, you will deal true damage equal to 10% of your AP. If your AP increases, that isn't a "Damage increase" by the rules of the game. Yes, the damage is increased, but learn to separate game terms and common vernacular. Tanks don't have 200mm cannons in League either. Don't see you railing about that, do I?
Nothing else in the game reduces true damage. Exhaust reduces all the damage you do. Not true damage.

This shouldn't happen. True damage has been specifically stated to not be affected by any increases or reductions, and so it should be constant even when under a turret's damage reduction. Hopefully we'll get a fix for this soon.

From the LoL wiki post on Laser Turrets:

LIGHTNING ROD

75% armor penetration

Unique Passive - Lightning Rod: Deals damage in a continuous beam and cannot be dodged. Deals up to 125% additional damage the longer it targets the same target.
With every hit, the beam gains 6 heat until 120 heat is reached. When the beam switches targets, heat is reset.

Gains +1.05% damage per point of heat, up to a maximum of +125% extra damage.
Unique Passive - Agony: Targets hit will have their movement speed reduced by 10% and damage reduced by 15%.
-- **This does affect true damage.**
